title: Computer Basics
description: Test your knowledge of basic computer concepts.

questions.questionText: What does CPU stand for?
questions.explanation: CPU stands for Central Processing Unit, which is the primary component of a computer that performs most of the processing.

questions.questionText: What is the primary function of the operating system?
questions.explanation: The operating system is responsible for managing the computer's hardware and software resources.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a storage device?
questions.explanation: A hard disk is a storage device used to store data permanently.

questions.questionText: What is RAM used for?
questions.explanation: RAM (Random Access Memory) is used to store data temporarily while the computer is running.

questions.questionText: Which of these is a type of computer network?
questions.explanation: The internet is a global network of interconnected computers that can communicate with each other.

title: Programming Basics
description: Test your knowledge of basic programming concepts.

questions.questionText: What is the main function in C programming?
questions.explanation: In C programming, the main() function is the entry point of every program.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a programming language?
questions.explanation: Python is a high-level programming language, whereas HTML, CSS, and XML are markup or styling languages.

questions.questionText: What is a variable in programming?
questions.explanation: A variable is a placeholder used to store data that can be changed during the execution of the program.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a loop in programming?
questions.explanation: A 'while' loop is used to repeatedly execute a block of code as long as a given condition is true.

questions.questionText: What does 'HTML' stand for?
questions.explanation: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language, and it is used to structure web pages.

title: Computer Hardware
description: Test your knowledge of computer hardware components.

questions.questionText: What does the motherboard do?
questions.explanation: The motherboard connects all hardware components of a computer and allows them to communicate with each other.

questions.questionText: Which component is considered the 'brain' of the computer?
questions.explanation: The CPU (Central Processing Unit) is considered the brain of the computer as it performs most of the processing.

questions.questionText: What is the function of the graphics card?
questions.explanation: The graphics card is responsible for processing and rendering visual data to display images on the monitor.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a storage device?
questions.explanation: The hard disk is a storage device that stores data permanently in a computer.

questions.questionText: What does RAM stand for?
questions.explanation: RAM stands for Random Access Memory, which is used to temporarily store data for quick access during program execution.

title: Computer Software
description: Test your knowledge of different types of computer software.

questions.questionText: Which of these is an example of system software?
questions.explanation: System software includes the operating system, such as Windows 10, which manages hardware and software resources.

questions.questionText: What is an example of application software?
questions.explanation: Application software is designed for end-users to perform specific tasks, such as word processing with Microsoft Word.

questions.questionText: Which of these is open-source software?
questions.explanation: Android is an open-source mobile operating system, whereas others are proprietary software.

questions.questionText: Which software is used for graphic design?
questions.explanation: Adobe Photoshop is a popular graphic design software used for image editing and design.

questions.questionText: Which of these is a type of database software?
questions.explanation: Oracle is a database management system used to manage large volumes of data.

title: Internet and Networking
description: Test your knowledge of internet and networking concepts.

questions.questionText: What does IP stand for in networking?
questions.explanation: IP stands for Internet Protocol, which is used to identify devices on a network and route data between them.

questions.questionText: Which protocol is used to transfer files over the internet?
questions.explanation: FTP (File Transfer Protocol) is used to transfer files between computers over the internet.

questions.questionText: What is a router used for?
questions.explanation: A router connects devices to a network and routes data between them, often providing internet access.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a type of network?
questions.explanation: LAN (Local Area Network), WAN (Wide Area Network), and MAN (Metropolitan Area Network) are all types of networks.

questions.questionText: What does DNS stand for?
questions.explanation: DNS (Domain Name System) translates domain names into IP addresses, allowing browsers to access websites.
